result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tarneshia N Harrell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tarneshia N Harrell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tarneshia N Harrell in court.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court for Tarneshia N Harrell.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
Defense motion to withdraw as counsel due to a ethical matters .Court Granted defense motion to withdraw as counsel and ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel. 
Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo to notify the SPD Office new counsel needs to be appointed.    
Case remains calendared in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tarneshia N Harrell in court with attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state. Defense requests resolution date.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 13.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RBE.

Defendant Tarneshia N Harrell in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/12/22 @ 1p
